definitions.definition: To make a sudden attack (e.g. on an enemy from a defended position).
examples: A feeding strategy of some birds is to sally out from a perch to snatch an insect and then returning to the same or a different perch.

definitions.definition: To set out on an excursion; venture; depart (often followed by "forth").
To venture off the beaten path.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To make a sudden attack (e.g. on an enemy from a defended position).
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To set out on an excursion; venture; depart (often followed by "forth").
( intransitive ) To venture off the beaten path.
